column.name: granted
column.remarks: Whether VLJ has determined that there is sufficient cause to fast-track an appeal, i.e. grant or deny the motion to AOD.

column.name: person_id
column.remarks: Appellant ID

column.name: reason
column.remarks: VLJ's rationale for their decision on motion to AOD.

table.name: appeals
table.remarks: Decision reviews intaken for AMA appeals to the board (also known as a notice of disagreement).

column.name: closest_regional_office
column.remarks: The code for the regional office closest to the Veteran on the appeal.

column.name: docket_range_date
column.remarks: Date that appeal was added to hearing docket range.

column.name: docket_type
column.remarks: The docket type selected by the Veteran on their appeal form, which can be hearing, evidence submission, or direct review.

column.name: established_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the appeal has successfully been intaken into Caseflow by the user.

column.name: establishment_attempted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the appeal's establishment was last attempted.

column.name: establishment_canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: establishment_error
column.remarks: The error message if attempting to establish the appeal resulted in an error. This gets cleared once the establishment is successful.

column.name: establishment_last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the the job is eligible to run (can be reset to restart the job).

column.name: establishment_processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the establishment has succeeded in processing.

column.name: establishment_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the the intake was submitted for asynchronous processing.

column.name: legacy_opt_in_approved
column.remarks: Indicates whether a Veteran opted to withdraw matching issues from the legacy process. If there is a matching legacy issue and it is not withdrawn then it is ineligible for the decision review.

column.name: poa_participant_id
column.remarks: Used to identify the power of attorney (POA) at the time the appeal was dispatched to BVA. Sometimes the POA changes in BGS after the fact, and BGS only returns the current representative.

column.name: receipt_date
column.remarks: Receipt date of the appeal form. Used to determine which issues are within the timeliness window to be appealed. Only issues decided prior to the receipt date will show up as contestable issues.

column.name: stream_docket_number
column.remarks: Multiple appeals with the same docket number indicate separate appeal streams, mimicking the structure of legacy appeals.

column.name: stream_type
column.remarks: When multiple appeals have the same docket number, they are differentiated by appeal stream type, depending on the work being done on each appeal.

column.name: target_decision_date
column.remarks: If the appeal docket is direct review, this sets the target decision date for the appeal, which is one year after the receipt date.

column.name: uuid
column.remarks: The universally unique identifier for the appeal, which can be used to navigate to appeals/appeal_uuid. This allows a single ID to determine an appeal whether it is a legacy appeal or an AMA appeal.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The VBA corporate file number of the Veteran for this review. There can sometimes be more than one file number per Veteran.

column.name: veteran_is_not_claimant
column.remarks: Selected by the user during intake, indicates whether the Veteran is the claimant, or if the claimant is someone else such as a dependent. Must be TRUE if Veteran is deceased.

column.name: address
column.remarks: Full address of the location

column.name: appeal_id
column.remarks: Appeal/LegacyAppeal ID; use as FK to appeals/legacy_appeals

column.name: appeal_type
column.remarks: 'Appeal' or 'LegacyAppeal'

column.name: city
column.remarks: i.e 'New York', 'Houston', etc

column.name: classification
column.remarks: The classification for location; i.e 'Regional Benefit Office', 'VA Medical Center (VAMC)', etc

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing location was created

column.name: distance
column.remarks: Distance between appellant's location and the hearing location

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Id associated with the facility; i.e 'vba_313', 'vba_354a', 'vba_317', etc

column.name: facility_type
column.remarks: The type of facility; i.e, 'va_benefits_facility', 'va_health_facility', 'vet_center', etc

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of location; i.e 'Chicago Regional Benefit Office', 'Jennings VA Clinic', etc

column.name: state
column.remarks: State in abbreviated form; i.e 'NY', 'CA', etc

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing location was updated

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The VBA corporate file number of the Veteran for the appeal

table.name: bgs_attorneys
table.remarks: Cache of unique BGS attorney data — used for adding claimants to cases pulled from POA data

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Standard created_at/updated_at timestamps

column.name: last_synced_at
column.remarks: The last time BGS was checked

column.name: participant_id
column.remarks: Participant ID

column.name: record_type
column.remarks: Known types: POA State Organization, POA National Organization, POA Attorney, POA Agent, POA Local/Regional Organization

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Standard created_at/updated_at timestamps

table.name: bgs_power_of_attorneys
table.remarks: Power of Attorney (POA) cached from BGS

column.name: authzn_change_clmant_addrs_ind
column.remarks: Authorization for POA to change claimant address

column.name: authzn_poa_access_ind
column.remarks: Authorization for POA access

column.name: claimant_participant_id
column.remarks: Claimant participant ID -- use as FK to claimants

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Standard created_at/updated_at timestamps

column.name: file_number
column.remarks: Claimant file number

column.name: last_synced_at
column.remarks: The last time BGS was checked

column.name: legacy_poa_cd
column.remarks: Legacy POA code

column.name: poa_participant_id
column.remarks: POA participant ID -- use as FK to people

column.name: representative_name
column.remarks: POA name

column.name: representative_type
column.remarks: POA type

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Standard created_at/updated_at timestamps

table.name: board_grant_effectuations
table.remarks: Represents the work item of updating records in response to a granted issue on a Board appeal. Some are represented as contentions on an EP in VBMS. Others are tracked via Caseflow tasks.

column.name: appeal_id
column.remarks: The ID of the appeal containing the granted issue being effectuated.

column.name: contention_reference_id
column.remarks: The ID of the contention created in VBMS. Indicates successful creation of the contention. If the EP has been rated, this contention could have been connected to a rating issue. That connection is used to map the rating issue back to the decision issue.

column.name: decision_document_id
column.remarks: The ID of the decision document which triggered this effectuation.

column.name: decision_sync_attempted_at
column.remarks: When the EP is cleared, an asyncronous job attempts to map the resulting rating issue back to the decision issue. Timestamp representing the time the job was last attempted.

column.name: decision_sync_canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: decision_sync_error
column.remarks: Async job processing last error message. See description for decision_sync_attempted_at for the decision sync job description.

column.name: decision_sync_last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the the job is eligible to run (can be reset to restart the job).

column.name: decision_sync_processed_at
column.remarks: Async job processing completed timestamp. See description for decision_sync_attempted_at for the decision sync job description.

column.name: decision_sync_submitted_at
column.remarks: Async job processing start timestamp. See description for decision_sync_attempted_at for the decision sync job description.

column.name: end_product_establishment_id
column.remarks: The ID of the end product establishment created for this board grant effectuation.

column.name: granted_decision_issue_id
column.remarks: The ID of the granted decision issue.

column.name: last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Async job processing most recent start timestamp

column.name: case_type
column.remarks: The case type, i.e. original, post remand, CAVC remand, etc

column.name: closest_regional_office_city
column.remarks: Closest regional office to the veteran

column.name: closest_regional_office_key
column.remarks: Closest regional office to the veteran in 4 character key

column.name: is_aod
column.remarks: Whether the case is Advanced on Docket

column.name: issue_count
column.remarks: Number of issues on the appeal.

column.name: power_of_attorney_name
column.remarks: 'Firstname Lastname' of power of attorney

column.name: suggested_hearing_location
column.remarks: Suggested hearing location in 'City, State (Facility Type)' format

column.name: veteran_name
column.remarks: 'LastName, FirstName' of the veteran

table.name: cached_user_attributes
table.remarks: VACOLS cached staff table attributes

table.name: claimants
table.remarks: This table bridges decision reviews to participants when the participant is listed as a claimant on the decision review. A participant can be a claimant on multiple decision reviews.

column.name: decision_review_id
column.remarks: The ID of the decision review the claimant is on.

column.name: decision_review_type
column.remarks: The type of decision review the claimant is on.

column.name: notes
column.remarks: This is a notes field for adding claimant not listed and any supplementary information outside of unlisted claimant.

column.name: participant_id
column.remarks: The participant ID of the claimant.

column.name: payee_code
column.remarks: The payee_code for the claimant, if applicable. payee_code is required when the claim is processed in VBMS.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The class name for the single table inheritance type of Claimant, for example VeteranClaimant, DependentClaimant, AttorneyClaimant, or OtherClaimant.

column.name: canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

table.name: decision_issues
table.remarks: Issues that represent a decision made on a decision review.

column.name: benefit_type
column.remarks: Classification of the benefit being decided on. Maps 1 to 1 to VA lines of business, and typically used to know which line of business the decision correlates to.

column.name: caseflow_decision_date
column.remarks: This is a decision date for decision issues where decisions are entered in Caseflow, such as for appeals or for decision reviews with a business line that is not processed in VBMS.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp when row was created.

column.name: decision_review_id
column.remarks: ID of the decision review the decision was made on.

column.name: decision_review_type
column.remarks: Type of the decision review the decision was made on.

column.name: decision_text
column.remarks: If decision resulted in a change to a rating, the rating issue's decision text.

column.name: description
column.remarks: Optional description that the user can input for decisions made in Caseflow.

column.name: diagnostic_code
column.remarks: If a decision resulted in a rating, this is the rating issue's diagnostic code.

column.name: disposition
column.remarks: The disposition for a decision issue. Dispositions made in Caseflow and dispositions made in VBMS can have different values.

column.name: end_product_last_action_date
column.remarks: After an end product gets synced with a status of CLR (cleared), the end product's last_action_date is saved on any decision issues that are created as a result. This is used as a proxy for decision date for non-rating issues that are processed in VBMS because they don't have a rating profile date, and the exact decision date is not available.

column.name: participant_id
column.remarks: The Veteran's participant id.

column.name: percent_number
column.remarks: percent_number from RatingIssue (prcntNo from Rating Profile)

column.name: rating_issue_reference_id
column.remarks: Identifies the specific issue on the rating that resulted from the decision issue (a rating can have multiple issues). This is unique per rating issue.

column.name: rating_profile_date
column.remarks: The profile date of the rating that a decision issue resulted in (if applicable). The profile_date is used as an identifier for the rating, and is the date that most closely maps to what the Veteran writes down as the decision date.

column.name: rating_promulgation_date
column.remarks: The promulgation date of the rating that a decision issue resulted in (if applicable). It is used for calculating whether a decision issue is within the timeliness window to be appealed or get a higher level review.

column.name: subject_text
column.remarks: subject_text from RatingIssue (subjctTxt from Rating Profile)

column.name: errored_at
column.remarks: when the Distribution job suffered an error

column.name: started_at
column.remarks: when the Distribution job commenced

column.name: priority_push
column.remarks: Whether or not this distribution is a priority-appeals-only push to judges via a weekly job (not manually requested)

table.name: end_product_code_updates
table.remarks: Caseflow establishes end products in VBMS with specific end product codes. If that code is changed outside of Caseflow, that is tracked here.

column.name: code
column.remarks: The new end product code, if it has changed since last checked.

table.name: end_product_establishments
table.remarks: Represents end products that have been, or need to be established by Caseflow. Used to track the status of those end products as they are processed in VBMS and/or SHARE.

column.name: benefit_type_code
column.remarks: 1 if the Veteran is alive, and 2 if the Veteran is deceased. Not to be confused with benefit_type, which is unrelated.

column.name: claim_date
column.remarks: The claim_date for end product established.

column.name: claimant_participant_id
column.remarks: The participant ID of the claimant submitted on the end product.

column.name: code
column.remarks: The end product code, which determines the type of end product that is established. For example, it can contain information about whether it is rating, nonrating, compensation, pension, created automatically due to a Duty to Assist Error, and more.

column.name: committed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp indicating other actions performed as part of a larger atomic operation containing the end product establishment, such as creating contentions, are also complete.

column.name: development_item_reference_id
column.remarks: When a Veteran requests an informal conference with their higher level review, a tracked item is created. This stores the ID of the of the tracked item, it is also used to indicate the success of creating the tracked item.

column.name: doc_reference_id
column.remarks: When a Veteran requests an informal conference, a claimant letter is generated. This stores the document ID of the claimant letter, and is also used to track the success of creating the claimant letter.

column.name: established_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the end product was established.

column.name: last_synced_at
column.remarks: The time that the status of the end product was last synced with BGS. The end product is synced until it is canceled or cleared, meaning it is no longer active.

column.name: limited_poa_access
column.remarks: Indicates whether the limited Power of Attorney has access to view documents

column.name: limited_poa_code
column.remarks: The limited Power of Attorney code, which indicates whether the claim has a POA specifically for this claim, which can be different than the Veteran's POA

column.name: modifier
column.remarks: The end product modifier. For higher level reviews, the modifiers range from 030-039. For supplemental claims, they range from 040-049. The same modifier cannot be used twice for an active end product per Veteran. Once an end product is no longer active, the modifier can be used again.

column.name: payee_code
column.remarks: The payee_code of the claimant submitted for this end product.

column.name: reference_id
column.remarks: The claim_id of the end product, which is stored after the end product is successfully established in VBMS.

column.name: source_id
column.remarks: The ID of the source that resulted in this end product establishment.

column.name: source_type
column.remarks: The type of source that resulted in this end product establishment.

column.name: station
column.remarks: The station ID of the end product's station.

column.name: synced_status
column.remarks: The status of the end product, which is synced by a job. Once and end product is cleared (CLR) or canceled (CAN) the status is final and the end product will not continue being synced.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who performed the decision review intake.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The file number of the Veteran submitted when establishing the end product.

column.name: appeal_id
column.remarks: LegacyAppeal ID; use as FK to legacy_appeals

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when snapshot was created

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: LegacyHearing ID; use as FK to legacy_hearings

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when snapshot was updated

column.name: bva_poc
column.remarks: Hearing coordinator full name

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing day was created

column.name: created_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who created the Hearing Day

column.name: deleted_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing day was deleted

column.name: judge_id
column.remarks: User ID of judge who is assigned to the hearing day

column.name: lock
column.remarks: Determines if the hearing day is locked and can't be edited

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Any notes about hearing day

column.name: regional_office
column.remarks: Regional office key associated with hearing day

column.name: request_type
column.remarks: Hearing request types for all associated hearings; can be one of: 'T', 'C' or 'V'

column.name: room
column.remarks: The room at BVA where the hearing will take place

column.name: scheduled_for
column.remarks: The date when all associated hearings will take place

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing day was updated

column.name: updated_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who most recently updated the Hearing Day

column.name: address
column.remarks: Full address of the location

column.name: city
column.remarks: i.e 'New York', 'Houston', etc

column.name: classification
column.remarks: The classification for location; i.e 'Regional Benefit Office', 'VA Medical Center (VAMC)', etc

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing location was created

column.name: distance
column.remarks: Distance between appellant's location and the hearing location

column.name: facility_id
column.remarks: Id associated with the facility; i.e 'vba_313', 'vba_354a', 'vba_317', etc

column.name: facility_type
column.remarks: The type of facility; i.e, 'va_benefits_facility', 'va_health_facility', 'vet_center', etc

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: Hearing/LegacyHearing ID; use as FK to hearings/legacy_hearings

column.name: hearing_type
column.remarks: 'Hearing' or 'LegacyHearing'

column.name: name
column.remarks: Name of location; i.e 'Chicago Regional Benefit Office', 'Jennings VA Clinic', etc

column.name: state
column.remarks: State in abbreviated form; i.e 'NY', 'CA', etc

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing location was updated

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when association was created

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: Hearing/LegacyHearing ID; use as FK to hearings/legacy_hearings

column.name: hearing_task_id
column.remarks: associated HearingTask ID; use as fk to tasks

column.name: hearing_type
column.remarks: 'Hearing' or 'LegacyHearing'

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when association was updated

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing view was created

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: Hearing/LegacyHearing ID; use as FK to hearings/legacy_hearings

column.name: hearing_type
column.remarks: 'Hearing' or 'LegacyHearing'

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when hearing view was updated

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: User ID; use as FK to users

column.name: appeal_id
column.remarks: Appeal ID; use as FK to appeals

column.name: bva_poc
column.remarks: Hearing coordinator full name

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp when row was created.

column.name: created_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who created the Hearing

column.name: disposition
column.remarks: Hearing disposition; can be one of: 'held', 'postponed', 'no_show', or 'cancelled'

column.name: evidence_window_waived
column.remarks: Determines whether the veteran/appelant has wavied the 90 day evidence hold

column.name: hearing_day_id
column.remarks: HearingDay ID; use as FK to HearingDays

column.name: judge_id
column.remarks: User ID of judge who will hold the hearing

column.name: military_service
column.remarks: Periods and circumstances of military service

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Any notes taken prior or post hearing

column.name: prepped
column.remarks: Determines whether the judge has checked the hearing as prepped

column.name: representative_name
column.remarks: Name of Appellant's representative if applicable

column.name: room
column.remarks: The room at BVA where the hearing will take place; ported from associated HearingDay

column.name: scheduled_time
column.remarks: Date and Time when hearing will take place

column.name: summary
column.remarks: Summary of hearing

column.name: transcript_requested
column.remarks: Determines whether the veteran/appellant has requested the hearing transcription

column.name: transcript_sent_date
column.remarks: Date of when the hearing transcription was sent to the Veteran/Appellant

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when record was last updated.

column.name: updated_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who most recently updated the Hearing

column.name: witness
column.remarks: Witness/Observer present during hearing

table.name: higher_level_reviews
table.remarks: Intake data for Higher Level Reviews.

column.name: benefit_type
column.remarks: The benefit type selected by the Veteran on their form, also known as a Line of Business.

column.name: establishment_attempted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for the most recent attempt at establishing a claim.

column.name: establishment_canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: establishment_error
column.remarks: The error captured for the most recent attempt at establishing a claim if it failed. This is removed once establishing the claim succeeds.

column.name: establishment_last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for the latest attempt at establishing the End Products for the Decision Review.

column.name: establishment_processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the End Product Establishments for the Decision Review successfully finished processing.

column.name: establishment_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the Higher Level Review was submitted by a Claims Assistant. This adds the End Product Establishment to a job to finish processing asynchronously.

column.name: informal_conference
column.remarks: Indicates whether a Veteran selected on their Higher Level Review form to have an informal conference. This creates a claimant letter and a tracked item in BGS.

column.name: legacy_opt_in_approved
column.remarks: Indicates whether a Veteran opted to withdraw their Higher Level Review request issues from the legacy system if a matching issue is found. If there is a matching legacy issue and it is not withdrawn, then that issue is ineligible to be a new request issue and a contention will not be created for it.

column.name: receipt_date
column.remarks: The date that the Higher Level Review form was received by central mail. This is used to determine which issues are eligible to be appealed based on timeliness. Only issues decided prior to the receipt date will show up as contestable issues. It is also the claim date for any associated end products that are established.

column.name: same_office
column.remarks: Whether the Veteran wants their issues to be reviewed by the same office where they were previously reviewed. This creates a special issue on all of the contentions created on this Higher Level Review.

column.name: uuid
column.remarks: The universally unique identifier for the Higher Level Review. Can be used to link to the claim after it is completed.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The file number of the Veteran that the Higher Level Review is for.

column.name: veteran_is_not_claimant
column.remarks: Indicates whether the Veteran is the claimant on the Higher Level Review form, or if the claimant is someone else like a spouse or a child. Must be TRUE if the Veteran is deceased.

table.name: intakes
table.remarks: Represents the intake of an form or request made by a veteran.

column.name: cancel_other
column.remarks: Notes added if a user canceled an intake for any reason other than the stock set of options.

column.name: cancel_reason
column.remarks: The reason the intake was canceled. Could have been manually canceled by a user, or automatic.

column.name: completed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the intake was completed, whether it was successful or not.

column.name: completion_started_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the user submitted the intake to be completed.

column.name: completion_status
column.remarks: Indicates whether the intake was successful, or was closed by being canceled, expired, or due to an error.

column.name: detail_id
column.remarks: The ID of the record created as a result of the intake.

column.name: detail_type
column.remarks: The type of the record created as a result of the intake.

column.name: error_code
column.remarks: If the intake was unsuccessful due to a set of known errors, the error code is stored here. An error is also stored here for RAMP elections that are connected to an active end product, even though the intake is a success.

column.name: started_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the intake was created, which happens when a user successfully searches for a Veteran.

column.name: type
column.remarks: The class name of the intake.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who created the intake.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The VBA corporate file number of the Veteran for this review. There can sometimes be more than one file number per Veteran.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Default created_at/updated_at

column.name: job_id
column.remarks: The job to which the note applies

column.name: note
column.remarks: The note

column.name: send_to_intake_user
column.remarks: Should the note trigger a message to the job intake user

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Default created_at/updated_at

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The user who created the note

table.name: judge_team_roles
table.remarks: Defines roles for individual members of judge teams

column.name: blue_water
column.remarks: Blue Water

column.name: burn_pit
column.remarks: Burn Pit

column.name: military_sexual_trauma
column.remarks: Military Sexual Trauma (MST)

column.name: no_special_issues
column.remarks: Affirmative no special issues, added belatedly

column.name: us_court_of_appeals_for_veterans_claims
column.remarks: US Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims (CAVC)

column.name: appeal_id
column.remarks: LegacyAppeal ID; use as FK to legacy_appeals

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp when row was created.

column.name: created_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who created the Legacy Hearing

column.name: hearing_day_id
column.remarks: The hearing day the hearing will take place on

column.name: military_service
column.remarks: Periods and circumstances of military service

column.name: prepped
column.remarks: Determines whether the judge has checked the hearing as prepped

column.name: summary
column.remarks: Summary of hearing

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when record was last updated.

column.name: updated_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who most recently updated the Legacy Hearing

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: User ID of judge who will hold the hearing

column.name: vacols_id
column.remarks: Corresponds to VACOLS’ hearsched.hearing_pkseq

column.name: witness
column.remarks: Witness/Observer present during hearing

table.name: legacy_issue_optins
table.remarks: When a VACOLS issue from a legacy appeal is opted-in to AMA, this table keeps track of the related request_issue, and the status of processing the opt-in, or rollback if the request issue is removed from a Decision Review.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: When a Request Issue is connected to a VACOLS issue on a legacy appeal, and the Veteran has agreed to withdraw their legacy appeals, a legacy_issue_optin is created at the time the Decision Review is successfully intaken. This is used to indicate that the legacy issue should subsequently be opted into AMA in VACOLS.

column.name: legacy_issue_id
column.remarks: The legacy issue being opted in, which connects to the request issue

column.name: optin_processed_at
column.remarks: The timestamp for when the opt-in was successfully processed, meaning it was updated in VACOLS as opted into AMA.

column.name: original_disposition_code
column.remarks: The original disposition code of the VACOLS issue being opted in. Stored in case the opt-in is rolled back.

column.name: original_disposition_date
column.remarks: The original disposition date of the VACOLS issue being opted in. Stored in case the opt-in is rolled back.

column.name: request_issue_id
column.remarks: The request issue connected to the legacy VACOLS issue that has been opted in.

column.name: rollback_created_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the connected request issue is removed from a Decision Review during edit, indicating that the opt-in needs to be rolled back.

column.name: rollback_processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when a rolled back opt-in has successfully finished being rolled back.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatically populated when the record is updated.

column.name: original_legacy_appeal_disposition_code
column.remarks: The original disposition code of legacy appeal being opted in

column.name: original_legacy_appeal_decision_date
column.remarks: The original disposition date of a legacy appeal being opted in

column.name: folder_decision_date
column.remarks: Decision date on case record folder

table.name: legacy_issues
table.remarks: On an AMA decision review, when a veteran requests to review an issue that is already being contested on a legacy appeal, the legacy issue is connected to the request issue. If the veteran also chooses to opt their legacy issues into AMA and the issue is eligible to be transferred to AMA, the issues are closed in VACOLS through a legacy issue opt-in. This table stores the legacy issues connected to each request issue, and the record for opting them into AMA (if applicable).

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Default created_at/updated_at

column.name: request_issue_id
column.remarks: The request issue the legacy issue is being connected to.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Default created_at/updated_at

column.name: vacols_id
column.remarks: The VACOLS ID of the legacy appeal that the legacy issue is part of.

column.name: vacols_sequence_id
column.remarks: The sequence ID of the legacy issue on the legacy appeal. The vacols_id and vacols_sequence_id form a composite key to identify a specific legacy issue.

column.name: detail_id
column.remarks: ID of the related object

column.name: detail_type
column.remarks: Model name of the related object

column.name: message_type
column.remarks: The type of event that caused this message to be created

column.name: read_at
column.remarks: When the message was read

column.name: text
column.remarks: The message

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The user for whom the message is intended

column.name: participant_id
column.remarks: Organizations BGS partipant id

column.name: role
column.remarks: Role users in organization must have, if present

column.name: status
column.remarks: Whether organization is active, inactive, or in some other Status.

column.name: status_updated_at
column.remarks: Track when organization status last changed.

column.name: type
column.remarks: Single table inheritance

column.name: url
column.remarks: Unique portion of the organization queue url

column.name: accepts_priority_pushed_cases
column.remarks: Whether a JudgeTeam currently accepts distribution of automatically pushed priority cases

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: Person email address, cached from BGS

column.name: first_name
column.remarks: Person first name, cached from BGS

column.name: last_name
column.remarks: Person last name, cached from BGS

column.name: middle_name
column.remarks: Person middle name, cached from BGS

column.name: name_suffix
column.remarks: Person name suffix, cached from BGS

column.name: ssn
column.remarks: Person Social Security Number, cached from BGS

table.name: post_decision_motions
table.remarks: Stores the disposition and associated task of post-decisional motions handled by the Litigation Support Team: Motion for Reconsideration, Motion to Vacate, and Clear and Unmistakeable Error.

column.name: disposition
column.remarks: Possible options are Grant, Deny, Withdraw, and Dismiss

column.name: vacate_type
column.remarks: Granted motion to vacate can be Straight Vacate, Vacate and Readjudication, or Vacate and De Novo.

column.name: vacated_decision_issue_ids
column.remarks: When a motion to vacate is partially granted, this includes an array of the appeal's decision issue IDs that were chosen for vacatur in this post-decision motion. For full grant, this includes all prior decision issue IDs.

table.name: ramp_closed_appeals
table.remarks: Keeps track of legacy appeals that are closed or partially closed in VACOLS due to being transitioned to a RAMP election. This data can be used to rollback the RAMP Election if needed.

column.name: closed_on
column.remarks: The datetime that the legacy appeal was closed in VACOLS and opted into RAMP.

column.name: nod_date
column.remarks: The date when the Veteran filed a Notice of Disagreement for the original claims decision in the legacy system.

column.name: partial_closure_issue_sequence_ids
column.remarks: If the entire legacy appeal could not be closed and moved to the RAMP Election, the VACOLS sequence IDs of issues on the legacy appeal which were closed are stored here, indicating that it was a partial closure.

column.name: ramp_election_id
column.remarks: The ID of the RAMP election that closed the legacy appeal.

column.name: vacols_id
column.remarks: The VACOLS BFKEY of the legacy appeal that has been closed and opted into RAMP.

table.name: ramp_election_rollbacks
table.remarks: If a RAMP election needs to get rolled back, for example if the EP is canceled, it is tracked here. Also any VACOLS issues that were closed in the legacy system and opted into RAMP are re-opened in the legacy system.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the rollback was created.

column.name: ramp_election_id
column.remarks: The ID of the RAMP Election being rolled back.

column.name: reason
column.remarks: The reason for rolling back the RAMP Election. Rollbacks happen automatically for canceled RAMP Election End Products, but can also happen for other reason such as by request.

column.name: reopened_vacols_ids
column.remarks: The IDs of any legacy appeals which were reopened as a result of rolling back the RAMP Election, corresponding to the VACOLS BFKEY.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the rollback was last updated.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The user who created the RAMP Election rollback, typically a system user.

table.name: ramp_elections
table.remarks: Intake data for RAMP elections.

column.name: established_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the review successfully established, including any related actions such as establishing a claim in VBMS if applicable.

column.name: notice_date
column.remarks: The date that the Veteran was notified of their option to opt their legacy appeals into RAMP.

column.name: option_selected
column.remarks: Indicates whether the Veteran selected for their RAMP election to be processed as a higher level review (with or without a hearing), a supplemental claim, or a board appeal.

column.name: receipt_date
column.remarks: The date that the RAMP form was received by central mail.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The VBA corporate file number of the Veteran for this review. There can sometimes be more than one file number per Veteran.

table.name: ramp_issues
table.remarks: Issues added to an end product as contentions for RAMP reviews. For RAMP elections, these are created in VBMS after the end product is established and updated in Caseflow when the end product is synced. For RAMP refilings, these are selected from the RAMP election's issues and added to the RAMP refiling end product that is established.

column.name: contention_reference_id
column.remarks: The ID of the contention created in VBMS that corresponds to the RAMP issue.

column.name: description
column.remarks: The description of the contention in VBMS.

column.name: review_id
column.remarks: The ID of the RAMP election or RAMP refiling for this issue.

column.name: review_type
column.remarks: The type of RAMP review the issue is on, indicating whether this is a RAMP election issue or a RAMP refiling issue.

column.name: source_issue_id
column.remarks: If a RAMP election issue added to a RAMP refiling, it is the source issue for the corresponding RAMP refiling issue.

table.name: ramp_refilings
table.remarks: Intake data for RAMP refilings, also known as RAMP selection.

column.name: appeal_docket
column.remarks: When the RAMP refiling option selected is appeal, they can select hearing, direct review or evidence submission as the appeal docket.

column.name: established_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the review successfully established, including any related actions such as establishing a claim in VBMS if applicable.

column.name: establishment_processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the end product establishments for the RAMP review finished processing.

column.name: establishment_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when an intake for a review was submitted by the user.

column.name: has_ineligible_issue
column.remarks: Selected by the user during intake, indicates whether the Veteran listed ineligible issues on their refiling.

column.name: option_selected
column.remarks: Which lane the RAMP refiling is for, between appeal, higher level review, and supplemental claim.

column.name: receipt_date
column.remarks: Receipt date of the RAMP form.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The VBA corporate file number of the Veteran for this review. There can sometimes be more than one file number per Veteran.

table.name: request_decision_issues
table.remarks: Join table for the has and belongs to many to many relationship between request issues and decision issues.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp when row was created.

column.name: decision_issue_id
column.remarks: The ID of the decision issue.

column.name: request_issue_id
column.remarks: The ID of the request issue.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatically populated when the record is updated.

table.name: request_issues
table.remarks: Each Request Issue represents the Veteran's response to a Rating Issue. Request Issues come in three flavors: rating, nonrating, and unidentified. They are attached to a Decision Review and (for those that track contentions) an End Product Establishment. A Request Issue can contest a rating issue, a decision issue, or a nonrating issue without a decision issue.

column.name: benefit_type
column.remarks: The Line of Business the issue is connected with.

column.name: closed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when the request issue was closed. The reason it was closed is in closed_status.

column.name: closed_status
column.remarks: Indicates whether the request issue is closed, for example if it was removed from a Decision Review, the associated End Product got canceled, the Decision Review was withdrawn.

column.name: contention_reference_id
column.remarks: The ID of the contention created on the End Product for this request issue. This is populated after the contention is created in VBMS.

column.name: contention_removed_at
column.remarks: When a request issue is removed from a Decision Review during an edit, if it has a contention in VBMS that is also removed. This field indicates when the contention has successfully been removed in VBMS.

column.name: contention_updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp indicating when a contention was successfully updated in VBMS.

column.name: contested_decision_issue_id
column.remarks: The ID of the decision issue that this request issue contests. A Request issue will contest either a rating issue or a decision issue

column.name: contested_issue_description
column.remarks: Description of the contested rating or decision issue. Will be either a rating issue's decision text or a decision issue's description.

column.name: contested_rating_decision_reference_id
column.remarks: The BGS id for contested rating decisions. These may not have corresponding contested_rating_issue_reference_id values.

column.name: contested_rating_issue_diagnostic_code
column.remarks: If the contested issue is a rating issue, this is the rating issue's diagnostic code. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue.

column.name: contested_rating_issue_profile_date
column.remarks: If the contested issue is a rating issue, this is the rating issue's profile date. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue.

column.name: contested_rating_issue_reference_id
column.remarks: If the contested issue is a rating issue, this is the rating issue's reference id. Will be nil if this request issue contests a decision issue.

column.name: corrected_by_request_issue_id
column.remarks: If this request issue has been corrected, the ID of the new correction request issue. This is needed for EP 930.

column.name: correction_type
column.remarks: EP 930 correction type. Allowed values: control, local_quality_error, national_quality_error where 'control' is a regular correction, 'local_quality_error' was found after the fact by a local quality review team, and 'national_quality_error' was similarly found by a national quality review team. This is needed for EP 930.

column.name: covid_timeliness_exempt
column.remarks: If a veteran requests a timeliness exemption that is related to COVID-19, this is captured when adding a Request Issue and available for reporting.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp when row was created

column.name: decision_date
column.remarks: Either the rating issue's promulgation date, the decision issue's approx decision date or the decision date entered by the user (for nonrating and unidentified issues)

column.name: decision_review_id
column.remarks: ID of the decision review that this request issue belongs to

column.name: decision_review_type
column.remarks: Class name of the decision review that this request issue belongs to

column.name: decision_sync_attempted_at
column.remarks: Async job processing last attempted timestamp

column.name: decision_sync_canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: decision_sync_error
column.remarks: Async job processing last error message

column.name: decision_sync_last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Async job processing most recent start timestamp

column.name: decision_sync_processed_at
column.remarks: Async job processing completed timestamp

column.name: decision_sync_submitted_at
column.remarks: Async job processing start timestamp

column.name: edited_description
column.remarks: The edited description for the contested issue, optionally entered by the user.

column.name: end_product_establishment_id
column.remarks: The ID of the End Product Establishment created for this request issue.

column.name: ineligible_due_to_id
column.remarks: If a request issue is ineligible due to another request issue, for example that issue is already being actively reviewed, then the ID of the other request issue is stored here.

column.name: ineligible_reason
column.remarks: The reason for a Request Issue being ineligible. If a Request Issue has an ineligible_reason, it is still captured, but it will not get a contention in VBMS or a decision.

column.name: is_unidentified
column.remarks: Indicates whether a Request Issue is unidentified, meaning it wasn't found in the list of contestable issues, and is not a new nonrating issue. Contentions for unidentified issues are created on a rating End Product if processed in VBMS but without the issue description, and someone is required to edit it in Caseflow before proceeding with the decision.

column.name: nonrating_issue_category
column.remarks: The category selected for nonrating request issues. These vary by business line.

column.name: nonrating_issue_description
column.remarks: The user entered description if the issue is a nonrating issue

column.name: notes
column.remarks: Notes added by the Claims Assistant when adding request issues. This may be used to capture handwritten notes on the form, or other comments the CA wants to capture.

column.name: ramp_claim_id
column.remarks: If a rating issue was created as a result of an issue intaken for a RAMP Review, it will be connected to the former RAMP issue by its End Product's claim ID.

column.name: rating_issue_associated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when a contention and its contested rating issue are associated in VBMS.

column.name: unidentified_issue_text
column.remarks: User entered description if the request issue is neither a rating or a nonrating issue

column.name: untimely_exemption
column.remarks: If the contested issue's decision date was more than a year before the receipt date, it is considered untimely (unless it is a Supplemental Claim). However, an exemption to the timeliness can be requested. If so, it is indicated here.

column.name: untimely_exemption_notes
column.remarks: Notes related to the untimeliness exemption requested.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp whenever the record changes.

column.name: vacols_id
column.remarks: The vacols_id of the legacy appeal that had an issue found to match the request issue.

column.name: vacols_sequence_id
column.remarks: The vacols_sequence_id, for the specific issue on the legacy appeal which the Claims Assistant determined to match the request issue on the Decision Review. A combination of the vacols_id (for the legacy appeal), and vacols_sequence_id (for which issue on the legacy appeal), is required to identify the issue being opted-in.

column.name: verified_unidentified_issue
column.remarks: A verified unidentified issue allows an issue whose rating data is missing to be intaken as a regular rating issue. In order to be marked as verified, a VSR needs to confirm that they were able to find the record of the decision for the issue.

column.name: veteran_participant_id
column.remarks: The veteran participant ID. This should be unique in upstream systems and used in the future to reconcile duplicates.

table.name: request_issues_updates
table.remarks: Keeps track of edits to request issues on a decision review that happen after the initial intake, such as removing and adding issues. When the decision review is processed in VBMS, this also tracks whether adding or removing contentions in VBMS for the update has succeeded.

column.name: after_request_issue_ids
column.remarks: An array of the active request issue IDs after a user has finished editing a decision review. Used with before_request_issue_ids to determine appropriate actions (such as which contentions need to be added).

column.name: attempted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the request issue update processing was last attempted.

column.name: before_request_issue_ids
column.remarks: An array of the active request issue IDs previously on the decision review before this editing session. Used with after_request_issue_ids to determine appropriate actions (such as which contentions need to be removed).

column.name: canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: corrected_request_issue_ids
column.remarks: An array of the request issue IDs that were corrected during this request issues update.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when record was initially created

column.name: edited_request_issue_ids
column.remarks: An array of the request issue IDs that were edited during this request issues update

column.name: error
column.remarks: The error message if the last attempt at processing the request issues update was not successful.

column.name: last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the processing for the request issues update was last submitted. Used to determine how long to continue retrying the processing job. Can be reset to allow for additional retries.

column.name: processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the request issue update successfully completed processing.

column.name: review_id
column.remarks: The ID of the decision review edited.

column.name: review_type
column.remarks: The type of the decision review edited.

column.name: submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when the request issues update was originally submitted.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when record was last updated.

column.name: user_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who edited the decision review.

column.name: withdrawn_request_issue_ids
column.remarks: An array of the request issue IDs that were withdrawn during this request issues update.

table.name: sent_hearing_email_events
table.remarks: Events related to hearings notification emails

column.name: email_address
column.remarks: Address the email was sent to

column.name: email_type
column.remarks: The type of email sent: cancellation, confirmation, updated_time_confirmation

column.name: external_message_id
column.remarks: The ID returned by the GovDelivery API when we send an email

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: Associated hearing

column.name: hearing_type
column.remarks: 'Hearing' or 'LegacyHearing'

column.name: recipient_role
column.remarks: The role of the recipient: veteran, representative, judge

column.name: sent_at
column.remarks: The date and time the email was sent

column.name: sent_by_id
column.remarks: User who initiated sending the email

column.name: blue_water
column.remarks: Blue Water

column.name: burn_pit
column.remarks: Burn Pit

column.name: cavc
column.remarks: US Court of Appeals for Veterans Claims (CAVC)

column.name: military_sexual_trauma
column.remarks: Military Sexual Trauma (MST)

column.name: no_special_issues
column.remarks: Affirmative no special issues, added belatedly

table.name: supplemental_claims
table.remarks: Intake data for Supplemental Claims.

column.name: benefit_type
column.remarks: The benefit type selected by the Veteran on their form, also known as a Line of Business.

column.name: decision_review_remanded_id
column.remarks: If an Appeal or Higher Level Review decision is remanded, including Duty to Assist errors, it automatically generates a new Supplemental Claim. If this Supplemental Claim was generated, then the ID of the original Decision Review with the remanded decision is stored here.

column.name: decision_review_remanded_type
column.remarks: The type of the Decision Review remanded if applicable, used with decision_review_remanded_id to as a composite key to identify the remanded Decision Review.

column.name: establishment_attempted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for the most recent attempt at establishing a claim.

column.name: establishment_canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: establishment_error
column.remarks: The error captured for the most recent attempt at establishing a claim if it failed. This is removed once establishing the claim succeeds.

column.name: establishment_last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for the latest attempt at establishing the End Products for the Decision Review.

column.name: establishment_processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the End Product Establishments for the Decision Review successfully finished processing.

column.name: establishment_submitted_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the Supplemental Claim was submitted by a Claims Assistant. This adds the End Product Establishment to a job to finish processing asynchronously.

column.name: legacy_opt_in_approved
column.remarks: Indicates whether a Veteran opted to withdraw their Supplemental Claim request issues from the legacy system if a matching issue is found. If there is a matching legacy issue and it is not withdrawn, then that issue is ineligible to be a new request issue and a contention will not be created for it.

column.name: receipt_date
column.remarks: The date that the Supplemental Claim form was received by central mail. Only issues decided prior to the receipt date will show up as contestable issues. It is also the claim date for any associated end products that are established. Supplemental Claims do not have the same timeliness restriction on contestable issues as Appeals and Higher Level Reviews.

column.name: uuid
column.remarks: The universally unique identifier for the Supplemental Claim. Can be used to link to the claim after it is completed.

column.name: veteran_file_number
column.remarks: The file number of the Veteran that the Supplemental Claim is for.

column.name: veteran_is_not_claimant
column.remarks: Indicates whether the Veteran is the claimant on the Supplemental Claim form, or if the claimant is someone else like a spouse or a child. Must be TRUE if the Veteran is deceased.

table.name: task_timers
table.remarks: Task timers allow tasks to be run asynchronously after some future date, like EvidenceSubmissionWindowTask.

column.name: attempted_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for most recent attempt to run.

column.name: canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp for record creation.

column.name: error
column.remarks: Async any error message from most recent failed attempt to run.

column.name: last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for most recent job start.

column.name: processed_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for when the job completes successfully.

column.name: submitted_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for initial job start.

column.name: task_id
column.remarks: ID of the Task to be run.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestmap for record update.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when transcription was created

column.name: expected_return_date
column.remarks: Expected date when transcription would be returned by the transcriber

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: Hearing ID; use as FK to hearings

column.name: problem_notice_sent_date
column.remarks: Date when notice of problem with recording was sent to appellant

column.name: problem_type
column.remarks: Any problem with hearing recording; could be one of: 'No audio', 'Poor Audio Quality', 'Incomplete Hearing' or 'Other (see notes)'

column.name: requested_remedy
column.remarks: Any remedy requested by the apellant for the recording problem; could be one of: 'Proceed without transcript', 'Proceed with partial transcript' or 'New hearing'

column.name: sent_to_transcriber_date
column.remarks: Date when the recording was sent to transcriber

column.name: task_number
column.remarks: Number associated with transcription

column.name: transcriber
column.remarks: Contractor who will transcribe the recording; i.e, 'Genesis Government Solutions, Inc.', 'Jamison Professional Services', etc

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when transcription was updated

column.name: uploaded_to_vbms_date
column.remarks: Date when the hearing transcription was uploaded to VBMS

column.name: efolder_documents_fetched_at
column.remarks: Date when efolder documents were cached in s3 for this user

column.name: status
column.remarks: Whether or not the user is an active user of caseflow

column.name: status_updated_at
column.remarks: When the user's status was last updated

column.name: canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned

column.name: request_id
column.remarks: The unique id of the request that caused this change

column.name: date_of_death
column.remarks: Date of Death reported by BGS, cached locally

column.name: ssn
column.remarks: The cached Social Security Number

column.name: attempted_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for most recent attempt to run.

column.name: canceled_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when job was abandoned.

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp when row was created.

column.name: error
column.remarks: Async any error message from most recent failed attempt to run.

column.name: last_submitted_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for most recent job start.

column.name: processed_at
column.remarks: Timestamp for when the virtual hearing was successfully processed.

column.name: submitted_at
column.remarks: Async timestamp for initial job start.

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Timestamp when record was last updated.

column.name: virtual_hearing_id
column.remarks: Virtual Hearing the conference is being established for.

column.name: alias
column.remarks: Alias for conference in Pexip

column.name: alias_with_host
column.remarks: Alias for conference in pexip with client_host

column.name: appellant_email
column.remarks: Appellant's email address

column.name: appellant_email_sent
column.remarks: Determines whether or not a notification email was sent to the appellant

column.name: conference_deleted
column.remarks: Whether or not the conference was deleted from Pexip

column.name: conference_id
column.remarks: ID of conference from Pexip

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when virtual hearing was created

column.name: created_by_id
column.remarks: User who created the virtual hearing

column.name: guest_pin
column.remarks: PIN number for guests of Pexip conference

column.name: guest_pin_long
column.remarks: Change the guest pin to store a longer pin with the # sign trailing

column.name: hearing_id
column.remarks: Associated hearing

column.name: hearing_type
column.remarks: 'Hearing' or 'LegacyHearing'

column.name: host_pin
column.remarks: PIN number for host of Pexip conference

column.name: host_pin_long
column.remarks: Change the host pin to store a longer pin with the # sign trailing

column.name: judge_email
column.remarks: Judge's email address

column.name: judge_email_sent
column.remarks: Whether or not a notification email was sent to the judge

column.name: representative_email
column.remarks: Veteran's representative's email address

column.name: representative_email_sent
column.remarks: Whether or not a notification email was sent to the veteran's representative

column.name: request_cancelled
column.remarks: Determines whether the user has cancelled the virtual hearing request

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Automatic timestamp of when virtual hearing was updated

column.name: updated_by_id
column.remarks: The ID of the user who most recently updated the virtual hearing

column.name: appellant_tz
column.remarks: Stores appellant timezone

column.name: representative_tz
column.remarks: Stores representative timezone

table.name: work_modes
table.remarks: Captures user's current work mode for appeals being worked

column.name: appeal_id
column.remarks: Appeal ID -- use as FK to AMA appeals and legacy appeals

column.name: appeal_type
column.remarks: Whether appeal_id is for AMA or legacy appeals

column.name: created_at
column.remarks: Standard created_at/updated_at timestamps

column.name: overtime
column.remarks: Whether the appeal is currently marked as being worked as overtime

column.name: updated_at
column.remarks: Standard created_at/updated_at timestamps
